comment.body: Check out Elm or Elixir :) Elm is a functional language the compiles to JS which you could use to make a Zine. Elixir is a ruby-like syntax on top of Erlang which you could use to make an XMPP bot (or clearnet web server)
@Quadrangle, nah dude :) Elixir is really great. We use in production at my company.
Functional languages are here to stay ^_^

@Quadrangle: Lol, yes a startup, no beanbags but I'm in a nice coworking space :) And don't worry, much much larger companies even where I live (not silicon valley or anywhere like that) use it, so it's not a hipster language really.

@Alek: I've been learning Elm through this video series if you're interested: http://courses.knowthen.com/courses/elm-for-beginners
@Quadrangle: Haha :) Don't be under the assumption we don't get shit done though. We've built a hell of a lot of stuff in the last year that we've been alive.
I have such a raging freedom right now
@Monetarycheddar: My freedom is pointing this way.
